comments:
Build 200404071337 + cheetah01

Install above SDK, and launch it with empty new workspace.
In it, don't do anything but:
- go to workbench
- immediately add cheetah01 patch, restart when prompted
- once restarted, go to workbench preferences and expand Java compiler pane.

If triggering JDT Core load explicitly before reaching the pref page, then 
everything works fine.

Actually, after having installed cheetah01, I installed another patch on top of 
it: cheetah02 (which I will soon expose publicly but can provide upon request 
for debug purpose).

I suspect some badness in platform/update ? Looks like it is still looking for 
org.eclipse.jdt.core_3.0.0 where it should look for 
org.eclipse.jdt.core_3.0.0.cheetah02.

When restarting, I had the following 2 suspicious warnings in log:
!ENTRY org.eclipse.osgi Apr 09, 2004 11:58:56.434
!MESSAGE Bundle 
reference:file:/d:/cheetah/eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.jdt.core_3.0.0/ [25] was 
not resolved
!ENTRY org.eclipse.osgi Apr 09, 2004 11:58:56.444
!MESSAGE Bundle 
reference:file:/d:/cheetah/eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.jdt.core_3.0.0.cheetah01/
 [86] was not resolved

comment 2 indicates you think this is an update issue.  Can this be moved to 
Update?

Reproduced by installing fresh 20040407 build, then patching it with cheetah02 
(available from update site: 'http://dev.eclipse.org/viewcvs/index.cgi/%
7Echeckout%7E/jdt-core-home/update-site' ).

Exceptions occur during Eclipse restart.

I will verify it with tomorrow's integration build, as I made a change a few 
days ago that affected updates/patches.

I tried the nightly build and I still see a problem.
Using the .options file from update.configurator, the trace shows that the 
jdt.core_3.0.0 bundle is uninstalled, and the jdt.core_3.0.0.cheetah is 
installed.
Also, and this is a bit odd, the org.eclipse.osgi_3.0.0 is also installed 
(again), but this should be ok, as it is already installed.

If I open the About dialog and select Plugin Details, I don't see any of the 
jdt plugins listed. Could this be a problem in the bundle resolving?

Also, after I get the preference page error and restart, this time the 
preference page works. There appears to be something going on in the runtime 
registry. Jeff, any thoughts?

When the new bundle is installed, are they being refreshed?

Are the plugins actually resolved?  Use "ss" in the OSGi console (spec -console 
on the command line).

Sidenote, it seems wrong that bundles should be installed again (you mention 
the osgi bundle).  There should be a precheck.  If there already is then there 
is a problem with it.

I ran eclipse using -console and typing ss after eclipse restarts (upon 
installing the cheetah patch) I can see the cheetah plugin as RESOLVED (and 
has the highest bundle number, 87), and the old jdt.core plugin is no longer 
there (and its id, 25, is skipped).

So, it appears that update configurator performed the correct operation, but 
something else is missing.

Moving to Equinox for comments.
*** Bug 59542 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
Can we close this in favour of bug 59542?

I think you can close this one and have bug 59542 no longer a duplicate.
The remaining issue in bug 59542 is the misterious inability to save the 
platform.xml once in a while.

closing.  Not sure how to unmark something as a duplicate.  Lets just consider 
this one not a duplicate and close.
